trans-unit.source: Defines the set of values that form a peer name record object.
This record includes items such as the peer name and the collection of endpoints with which it communicates.
Peer name records are used to define the individual peer nodes within a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
<xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord> objects are used to define individual nodes or peers within a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud>.
A peer name record object encapsulates all information published about a peer into a PNRP <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud>, including its name.
The PeerNameRecord class is designed for use with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameResolver> class.
Initializes a new default instance of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> class.
Initializes a new default instance of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> class.
Reference to the object that holds the data needed to deserialize this instance.
Context that provides the means for deserializing the data.
Also referred to as the source of the serialized data.
Gets or sets additional information about the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> object.
The maximum length of the comment is 39 Unicode characters.
The comment associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> object.
The default value for this property is `null`.
The comment to set is either larger than 39 Unicode characters or less than one character.
The comment to set is `null.`
Gets or sets application-defined binary data for the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> object.
The maximum amount of data that can be supplied is 4096 bytes.
This property cannot be `null`.
An array of bytes that holds the binary data associated with the entry.
The default value for this property is an empty (zero-length) array instance.
The length of the binary data array to set is either greater than 4096 or less than 1.
The data to set is `null.`

Gets an <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPointCollection"></xref> object that contains all the endpoints available to the peer associated with this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> object.
This property contains the set of endpoints, or peers in the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud>, nearest to the peer named in this <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord>.
These are the ones with which this peer communicates directly, rather than through an intermediary.
For each endpoint an IP address and port must be provided.
The maximum number of endpoints that can be provided is ten.
A <xref href="System.Net.IPEndPointCollection"></xref> object that contains a collection of <xref href="System.Net.IPEndPoint"></xref> objects.
These objects contain the endpoints of other peers participating within the associated peer cloud.
The default value for this property is `null`.
Populates a serialization information object with the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref>.
Holds the serialized data associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> object.
Contains the destination for the serialized stream associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerName"></xref> within this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> object.
A peer name is a string used to identify a peer resource.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord.PeerName"></xref> within this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> object.
The default value for this property is `null`.

Implements the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable"></xref> interface and returns the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> instance.
Holds the serialized data associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> instance.
Contains the destination for the serialized stream associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRecord"></xref> instance.
